reviews.review_msg: Sonya is a fantastic professor. She really cares about her students and wants to see them succeed. Whether you are interested in Labour Studies or just need the credits you will not regret this class. Highly recommend. Reading and course work are manageable. Put in the effort and you will do well.
Sonya teaches in a very straightforward manner with clear expectations. She cares about her students and ensures the concepts are clearly understood by everyone. Great class!

The materials are interesting - she tried to keep the class engaged, but there was a small class size and barely anyone participated. Mark is based off of assignments and take home exams. She marks hard, as class average was usually 70% and people rarely got above 85%. Worst trait: she takes forever marking and doesn't give you timely feedback...

If you are interested in Labour Studies take Sonya's course! Lectures can be a bit dry but she provides notes to help you follow along. Midterm and final were very easy as long as you review your notes.

Tom is a wonderful instructor. He always wants his students to do well, and is always willing to help whenever you need it. That being said, his "lectures" are mostly self-guided, meaning that instead of teaching, we learn the material  on our own, and discuss in class. Mid-term and final are easy if you study. Final is cumulative.

A great course from a great professor with a wide range of knowledge. His collaborative teaching style lets students interact with course material and understand it much more than only using a textbook (still, to do well you will need to read it thoroughly). Tom genuinely cares about the success of his students. I would take a class with him again.
